intro: Oxydectes myriantha, commonly known as the broadleaf waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Oxydectes myriantha is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
